What always runs but never walks. Often murmurs, never talks. Has a bed but never sleeps. An open mouth that never eats?
I don't have eyes, But once I did see. I once had thoughts, Now white and empty.
Bright as diamonds, Loud as thunder, Never still, A thing of wonder.
My life can be measured in hours, I only serve to be devoured. Slim, I am quick. Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe.
What has cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and water, but no fish?
Alive without breath, As cold as death, Clad in mail never clinking, Never thirsty, ever drinking
What goes through a door but never goes in or comes out?
